comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Josiah VanKirk Thompson was "a Pittsburgh banker, coal and fuel operator"--his niece Lida Nicolls made the news when she became Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis in 1911 (among her other newsmaking activities: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Lida_of_Thurn_and_Taxis freepages.family.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~pknox/other-pa/jv...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: freepages.family.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~pknox/other-pa/jv... seems to confirm pennylrichardsca's identification -- with a picture of the same man, probably some years younger. And also books.google.com/books?id=K-QDAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA21&lp... from "The Book of Prominent Pennsylvanians", published in 1913.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The sun., January 23, 1915, Page 4 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-01-23/ed-... reports rumors of financial woes for Thompson and shows what may be this photo.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca and swanq:  Thanks for the more complete identification of Thompson.  We'll include this in the description next time we update.
